messages.msgSnippet: i m not at all offended.   if i remember/understand it right, from sus s other post, her mother doesn t really act like a mother so why bestow that title on
messages.messageBody:
i'm not at all offended.   if i remember/understand it right, from
sus's other post, her 'mother' doesn't really act like a mother so why
bestow that title on her. it appears to me sus just giving her 'mother'
the title that best fits her actions and the role her 'mother' has
chosen. at least that's how i interpreted it:)
-susan
austin,tx

Thanks, Susan. I couldn't have said it better myself. And to those who
were offended by "the title" , I apologize. I don't want to offend
anyone, as a matter of fact, I'd like to feel like I have some friends
out there, somewhere.This has been a very stressful time, and I tend to
get a little lonely.
Thanks to all who offered advice and words of encouragment. It's nice
to know that I'm not the only mother in the world who has a child who
spins in circles when he's tired !! I'm just gonna try to relax and let
my boy be a boy, even if that means letting him bounce off the walls !!
Sus
